(Same as HLTH 385 8)
This interdisciplinary course will survey recent research in psychology, neuroscience, anthropology, and religious studies to investigate the role of compassion and empathy in human health, including how practices for cultivating compassion and empathy are secularized and implemented in schools, prisons, and other settings. This theory-practice-learning course will include in-class activities, individual reflective practices and journaling, and exploration of research design and measurement.
